Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from six fragments) of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below with lotus flower and palmette chain in added red and white, above two red bands; exterior: brown band at rim, above band of short vertical strokes between pairs of lines; below, painted decoration consisting of parts of two heads of females or possibly sphinxes to left (outlined with golden yellow; elaborately dressed hair with red fillets and plume, with white dots).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos the image depicts a row of sphinxes. The sherd may belong to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.508 which Lemos describes belonging to the Grey-Slip Group. The sherds in this group have a characteristically grey coloured slip. For parallels regarding the sphinxes, see British Museum 1888,0601.465.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 272, no. 700, pl. I, pl. 92)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 83)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 39, pl. V, no. 2)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VI, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0748) (phase 2)
